alert.note: Alert for Central and South Weld County; Northeast Weld County (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 14 at 5:03PM MDT by NWS Boulder
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Weld County through 545 PM MDT... At 503 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 6 miles southeast of Briggsdale, or 27 miles east of Greeley, moving east at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Briggsdale, Pawnee Buttes and Keota. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.

area.areaDesc: Central and South Weld County; Northeast Weld County
